derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'seizing, capture'): from Latin captio(n-), from capere 'take, seize'. Early senses 'arrest' and 'warrant for arrest' gave rise to 'statement of where, when, and by whose authority a warrant was issued' (late 17th cent.): this was usually appended to a legal document, hence the sense 'heading or appended wording' (late 18th cent.)

entry.def: A caption is the words printed underneath a picture or cartoon which explain what it is about.

example.ex: On the back of the photo is written the simple caption, 'Mrs. Monroe'.
example.tran: 照片背面只有简单的几个字——“梦露女士”。

entry.tran: 为(照片或漫画)添加说明文字
entry.def: When someone captions a picture or cartoon, they put a caption under it.

example.ex: The Sun had captioned a picture of Princess Diana 'Princess of Veils'...
example.tran: 《太阳报》在黛安娜王妃的一张照片下写了一段说明文字——“披着面纱的王妃”。
配图文字为“人民的力量”。

stems_affixes.word_buile: cap可取之处+able能……的→adj.有能力的, 能干的
capacity[[n.容量,才能]]→adj.宽阔的;容积大的
cap拿,抓,握住+acity表名词→拿住的能力→容量;才能
cap抓+ion表名词→抓住主要内容→标题
